entry.title: New Study Finds Only 0.3% Of Crypto Transactions Flagged As Illicit, Cash Remains King
entry.summary:
A recent study has found that despite the long-held belief that crypto assets facilitate criminal activity, perpetrators still overwhelmingly prefer cash for their illicit transactions.¬†
This revelation, published by Fortune and sourced from the Crypto Information Sharing and Analysis Center (CryptoISAC), challenges the narrative that digital assets are the first choice for criminal organizations such as Hamas.
TradFi Systems Estimated To Launder Up To $2 Trillion Annually
The study, ‚ÄúBlockchain‚Äôs Role in Mitigating Illicit Finance,‚Äù was developed in collaboration with Robert Whitaker, the director of law enforcement affairs at Merkle Science and a former supervisory special agent at the Department of Homeland Security.¬†
According to Whitaker, ‚ÄúCash will always be king because of i‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Belief Still Alive: HODLer Supply Grows By Another 959,000 BTC
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin long-term holders have seen their supply register a sharp net increase over the past month.
Bitcoin Long-Term Holder Supply Is Rapidly Growing Right Now
As explained by CryptoQuant community manager Maartunn in a new post on X, BTC supply has recently been maturing into the long-term holder cohort. The ‚Äúlong-term holders‚Äù (LTHs) refer to the Bitcoin investors who have been holding onto their coins since more than 155 days ago.
The LTHs make up one of the two main divisions of the BTC sector done on the basis of holding time, with the other cohort being known as the ‚Äúshort-term holders‚Äù (STHs). The STHs generally represent the fickle-minded side of the market, while the LTHs contain the resolute hands.
There are many indicators for tracking the beha‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Formally Moves to Appeal $125 Million Fine against Ripple
entry.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) yesterday (Wednesday) formally moved to appeal a federal judge's decision in the regulator‚Äôs case against Ripple, which resulted in a $125 million fine. SEC Files ‚ÄúNotice of Appeal‚Äù The regulator filed a "notice of appeal" to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, indicating its intention to challenge the final judgement by Judge Analisa Torres, who closed the four-year-old case against the crypto company last August. A ‚Äúnotice of appeal‚Äù is a formal filing in a superior court by a party involved in a lawsuit, notifying the court and the opposing side of its decision to appeal. Although the judge imposed a penalty on the blockchain company, it was significantly lower than the nearly $2 billion the SEC had sought in the form of recovery and fines. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Market Cap Shrinks By 6%, With Liquidations Surpassing $550 Million
entry.summary:
The crypto market cap is down by 6%, with more than half a billion crypto bets liquidated amid flaring geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.
Tensions In The Middle East Rattle The Crypto Market
The total crypto market cap has dropped by 6%, sliding to $2.24 trillion at press time, as geopolitical tensions between Iran and Israel escalate. Yesterday, Iran launched ballistic missiles at key Israeli locations, causing the market to remain volatile as Israel vowed to retaliate in the coming days.
According to data from CoinGlass, more than $556 million worth of futures contracts were liquidated in the past 24 hours. Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and Solana (SOL) saw liquidations worth over $143 million, $119 million, and $20 million, respectively.
Of the $556 million worth of ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Will Kraken‚Äôs Delisting Of Monero In Europe Push XMR Further Below $150?
entry.summary:
Kraken Exchange‚Äôs decision to delist Monero (XMR) sent shockwaves across the cryptocurrency space. Trading and deposits for Monero in the European Economic Area (EEA) will be shut off before the end of October, 2024. Increasing regulatory scrutiny was cited as a reason for the move. The pressure has dragged the coin‚Äôs price below $150, showing that privacy-focused cryptocurrencies still face a lot of setbacks.
The Price Decline
Monero has also not been spared in the rollercoaster ride in terms of price. Days before the Kraken delisting announcement, it was hovering around $158, failing to maintain its footing amidst a broader bearish trend that has eaten up much of the cryptocurrencies‚Äô value.
The news of the delisting has just aggravated the decline: XMR plummeted over 10% shor‚Ä¶

SUI & FTM continue to outperform in L1s. BNB to introduce gasless stablecoin transfers. Tether market share hits 75%. Australia launches 3-year CBDC program. Russia to pay China in crypto for war supplies. USDC available for Brazil & Mexico bank transfers. We are one of the biggest users of blockchain: Dimon. Kamala may push crypto firms abroad: Nansen CEO. Dragonfly looking to raise $500m fund. Bitget users hit 45m, most growth from TON. Gensler pushed to clarify his stance on airdrops. Binance denies involvement in WazirX hack. Janus Henderson to tokenise fund. TON partners with Curve for stablecoin swaps. LINK & Fireblocks partner for stablecoin issuance. WalletConnect seat to airdrop 185m WCT tokens.

entry.title: How Jan 6. Organizer Became Meme Coin Kingpin
entry.summary: Dustin Stockton is known as the ‚ÄúGodfather of Political Finance‚Äù but he wasn‚Äôt always known this way. He was originally heavily involved in campaigning for Donald Trump and was the lead organizer of January 6. As the protest came closer, he realized things would go south and backed out. From home, he watched Trump supporters raid the capitol building. He knew his life was never going to be the same.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 199 - SO ABOUT YESTERDAY
entry.summary: Crypto majors bounce with stocks & gold after CPI. Kamala odds flip Trump after Presidential debate. SUI, FTM, ICP, TON lead gains in Alt L1s. Grayscale launches XRP trust, SUI to follow. FTX unstakes part of SOL position, large unlocks in Q1. 5 major announcements coming for SOL this month. SOL active addresses hits ATH for any blockchain. ETH dominance falls to 14%, lowest level in 3 years. AI coins strong as Nvidia & chip optimism returns. SWIFT set to build infrastructure for RWA trading. Coinbase launches wrapped Bitcoin product. ENS integrated with Venmo & PayPal. Pendle introduces Bitcoin yield pools at 45%. POPCAT gets Kraken listing, leads top SOL memes. SUNDOG breaks $300m after ByBit spot listing. Casino tokens rise, RLB up 100% in 2 weeks. Ape Punk sells in ‚Äòheist‚Äô for 10ETH. XCOPY editions & 1/1s see high sales. Fantasy Top trading volume continues to grow. Trump family set to launch crypto project Monday.

entry.title: Why CEO Jack Lu Is Pushing Magic Eden Beyond NFTs
entry.summary: Magic Eden's grip on the NFT market has been cemented by a multi-chain approach under co-founder and CEO Jack Lu. Now the marketplace is pushing forward with a digital wallet that bridges Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana as it eyes other future expansions. Lu discusses Magic Eden's evolution since its early days, along with valuable lessons learned in the turbulent crypto industry.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 198 - THE GREAT APE HEIST!
entry.summary: Crypto rises with stocks after CPI falls again. Bitfinex BTC longs continue to grow. SUI again leads L1s, up 18%. FTX estate unstakes $24m SOL, still has $943m. Binance introduces SOL liquid staking. SWIFT introduces infrastructure for RWA transfers. Pendle launches Bitcoin yield pools. UK makes crypto legal property. India leads crypto adoption for second year. Vitalik won‚Äôt advertise L2s with multi-sig security. Based rollups seen as alternative future for ETH. Blockchain music start up raises $50m. Ford & Toyota file blockchain patents.

entry.title: Fomo Hour 197 - Debate Disaster
entry.summary: Crypto falls slightly after Presidential debate. Exchanges see highest BTC outflow since May. Be wary of Yen move for BTC: Hayes. SOL active addresses hit ATH. At least 5 massive SOL announcements coming: Mert. Binomial to introduce restaking on BNB. Indonesian exchange hacked for $22m. Atomic Wallet wins lawsuit over $100m hack. Lawyers argue Ellison shouldn‚Äôt go to jail. ENS integrated with Venmo & PayPal. Galaxy & State Street launch 3 crypto ETFs. Standard Chartered begins UAE crypto custody. AAVE leads resurgence in DeFi coins.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 196 - THE INFLOWS RETURN!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +$29m, ETH ETFs: -$5m. BTC rallies, ETF has first inflow in 9 trading days. BTC may have put in first higher low in 6 months. Saylor predicts $13m price for BTC. Wealth advisors quickly adopting BTC: BitWise CEO. Binance among few firms to get Indonesia license. Spot trading on CEXs up 30% in August. SEC made $4.68bn from crypto firms in 2023. $5.6bn lost to scams in 2023. XRP security status may be unchallenged in appeal. EtherFi announces credit card on Scroll. Base has more DEX users than other L2s combined. Tether & Tron create taskforce against crime. TIA still only making $585 in daily fees. WLD investigated by Singapore police.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 195 - CAN WE GET A BOUNCE?
entry.summary: BTC: 55.3k (+2%), ETH: 2320 (+1%), SOL: 130 (0%). Top Gainers: FTM, TAO, BTT, AAVE, TON, ATOM. Crypto mini-bounce continues, BTC reclaims $55k. BTC RSI hits lowest level since July 2021. Bitfinex longs continue to grow aggressively. BTC hashrate hits another ATH. BTC could hit $90k on Trump election: Bernstein. BlackRock settles intraday BTC trades off-chain. Spot BTC ETFs have been a failure: Bianco. Power giant Tepco explores Bitcoin mining. ETH Foundation & Vitalik continue to sell ETH. Farcaster DAU‚Äôs down 95%.
